intro: Epacris heteronema, commonly known as the variable epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained sandy soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract nectar-feeding insects. Epacris heteronema is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its resilience and beauty.
